item.title: To establish the position of Under Secretary of Commerce for Manufacturing in the Department of Commerce.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8562)

item.name: Advice and consent of the Senate

summary.text: Establishes a position of Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Manufacturing in the Department of Commerce (to be appointed by the President by and with the advice and consent of the Senate) who shall: (1) represent the interests of the manufacturing sector; (2) aid in the development of policies that promote the expansion of that sector; (3) review policies that may adversely impact that sector; and (4) submit annual reports that contain an overview of the state of the U.S. manufacturing sector, a forecast of its future, and an analysis of significant laws, regulations, and policies that adversely impact it.

bill.title: A bill to establish the position of Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Manufacturing in the Department of Commerce.

item.title: A bill to establish the position of Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Manufacturing in the Department of Commerce.
A bill to establish the position of Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Manufacturing in the Department of Commerce.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8562)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
